name: launch
posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: launch
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an event to celebrate or introduce something new

example.eg: How much champagne will we need for the launch?
example.egtrans: 这次发布会我们需要多少香槟酒？

example.eg: Illness prevented her attending the launch party for her latest novel.
example.egtrans: 她因病无法出席为她新近推出的小说举办的庆祝聚会。

dsense.name: launch
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an occasion when a ship is put into water, or a spacecraft is sent into space, for the first time
trans_examp.trans_cn: 下水（船首次出航）；发射（火箭首次升空）

example.eg: The launch of the space shuttle was delayed for 24 hours because of bad weather.
example.egtrans: 因天气情况不佳，宇宙飞船的发射被推迟了24个小时。

dsense.name: launch
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a boat that has an engine and carries passengers for short distances, especially on a lake or a river, or from the land to a larger boat
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤指河或湖上的）汽艇，摩托艇

name: launch
posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: launch
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to begin something such as a plan or introduce something new such as a product

example.eg: The programme was launched a year ago.
example.egtrans: 这项计划是1年前开始实施的。

example.eg: The airline will launch its new transatlantic service next month.
example.egtrans: 这家航空公司下个月将开辟一条新的跨越大西洋的航线。

example.eg: A devastating attack was launched on the rebel stronghold.
example.egtrans: 向叛军堡垒发起了猛烈的进攻。

example.eg: After working for the company for several years she decided to launch out on her own and set up in business.
example.egtrans: 在为该公司工作数年后，她决定在商界自立门户。

dsense.name: launch
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to send something out, such as a new ship into the water or a spacecraft into space

example.eg: A spokesman for the dockyard said they hoped to launch the first submarine within two years.
example.egtrans: 船厂发言人说他们希望在两年内让第一艘潜艇下水。

example.eg: The defender launched himself at the attacking player, bringing him to the ground.
example.egtrans: 防守队员猛地扑向进攻者，把他摔倒在地。
